channel.title: CVE Feed for tokio-rs -- axum-core
channel.description: The latest CVEs for tokio-rs -- axum-core

item.title: CVE-2022-3212|2024-08-03T01:00:10.862Z -- tokio-rs -- axum-core
item.description: <bytes::Bytes as axum_core::extract::FromRequest>::from_request would not, by default, set a limit for the size of the request body. That meant if a malicious peer would send a very large (or infinite) body your server might run out of memory and crash. This also applies to these extractors which used Bytes::from_request internally: axum::extract::Form axum::extract::Json String
